result.execSummary:
The defendant Luis E Ruiz-Ramirez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent; as to both counts

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12/18/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-36

miscConds.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Batterer's Intervnetion program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim until the batterer's treatment is complete, and unless approved by the court.
- Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the child(ren), if approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: 10 days to be served UPFRONT, with work release privileges. Defendant to report in on 10-13-15. The remaining 50 days STAYED pending review.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (18 pages) commencing OCTOBER 6, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Luis E Ruiz-Ramirez in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Luis E Ruiz-Ramirez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Spanish Interpreter, Brenda Bartholomew.
.
As to counts 1 and 3:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing proceeded...
.
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days served as to count 1, and 3 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, as to count 3. 
 Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation for up to 24 months, concurrent, with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; Defendant to serve 10 days up front, with work release privileges.  The remaining 50 days STAYED pending review, as to count 1.  Defendant to report in on 10/13/2015.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim until the batterer's treatment is complete, and unless approved by the court.  Defendant may have 3rd party contact for time with the child/ren, if approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
cab

Defendant Luis E Ruiz-Ramirez in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense requests a projected plea date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM038835  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/20/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MSJ dob 5/17/96

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
